intro: Tovomita trachycarpa, commonly known as the rough-seeded tovomita, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. Its fruit is a drupe, typically containing a single seed. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
